message:
I picked up the demo of Gatling Gears off XBLA last night.

At first blush it was very promising.  A twin-stick shooter that owes *more than a little* to Wanako's Assault Heroes franchise, albeit leaning slightly towards bullet hell territory.  The whole presented with a pleasingly crisp steampunk aesthetic and a more streamlined control system (as compared to Assault Heroes).

However, the demo as a whole failed to convince.  It's… OK, but I'm not sure it's worth the M$1200 asking price.  I see Eurogamer just awarded it a 5, which I feel is maybe a *little* harsh… but then, I did only play the demo.
DLC can go in here too right? Just finished Alan Wake's 'The Writer'. It's a must play for any fan. Damn glad I bought that
@Mr_V I felt exactly the same way. It was okay, but didn't seem remarkable in any way. Certainly not in a 1200 points kind of way.
Dungeons & Dragons: Daggerdale is hitting XBLA this week. I really hope it's good!
I wonder if anything will be hitting PSN this week? Or will the only hit take place with the use of a mouse?
